intro: Psoralea bituminosa var. plumosa, commonly known as the silky psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and pod fruits. The plant is distinguished by its soft, silky-hairy foliage and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it prefers a dry climate.
